intro: Guatteria megalophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The flowers are small and clustered, and the fruit is a dark, fleshy berry that is edible.
